example.translation: ‘The boy has lied to the mother.’

example.label: Nias
OldFreObl
example.translation: ‘It is the dog whom the man bites.’
‘The person who is eating isn’t black.’

example.label: MangFA
example.translation: ‘Did old woman X (name deleted) show you?’

example.label: MangMS
example.translation: ‘The man was hanging in the tree.’

example.label: MangNS
example.translation: ‘One tree is standing in the middle of the billabong.’

example.label: NiasMent
example.translation: ‘The monkey is afraid of the boy.’
‘The Dutch have often tried to plant potatoes in NiasNias.’

example.source: The morning star is the evening star.

example.label: Savosavo
example.translation: ‘and the green flower (is) on top of the pillow’ (lit.: ’and the green flower (is) the pillow its top’)
‘Owls are birds/ The owl is a bird.’

example.label: JamCopCon
example.translation: ‘That woman is playing Indian/pretending to be an Indian.’
‘[Talking about eggs of a megapode] Her child (i.e. egg) has a nice smell (when cooked).’, lit. ‘Fragrance having (is) her child.’
‘(It was) not a conscious being, this volcano.’
‘I was the only Solomon Islander.’ lit. ‘I myself (was) a Solomon Island person.’

example.label: EngExist
example.source: There is a tree (in the garden).

example.label: EngLoc
example.source: The tree is in the garden.

example.label: MojLoc
example.translation: ‘The man who’s going to kill the chicken tomorrow is in the house.’
‘There are no pigs in this village.’

example.label: MurEx
example.translation: ‘There is an owl up in the tree.’

example.label: MurS
example.translation: ‘The big crocodile goes into the river.’
‘There are none of these cattle that he may go to meet.’
‘There are cows (or the cows are there).’
‘There is one girl (or one girl is there).’
‘The boy is at the river.’ (lit. ‘The boy is at the big leg.’)

example.label: MaaZeroEx
example.translation: ‘They knew that there is God who is the father.’
‘…because there is no one who can face him.’
‘There isn’t a warrior who doesn’t want to (have his) hand be made blue.’
‘There is a book on the table.’
‘He has got many friends,’ lit.:‘Many friends are to him.’ original translation: ‘Er hat viele Freunde’ lit.: ‘Viele Freunde existieren [bei] ihm.’)
‘The man is in the house.’ original translation: ‘Der Mann ist im Haus.’
‘In Wolkite there is no water right now.’ original translation: ‘In Wolkite gibt es jetzt kein Wasser.’

example.label: ZayLoc
example.translation: ‘There is a man in the house.’
‘The man who’s going to kill the chicken tomorrow is in the house.’
‘There was a bull there, and he saw (the boy).’
‘There was a man who lived in the forest.’
‘There are ant hills all around my house.’
‘There is an ant in the sugar.’

example.label: HavEx
example.translation: ‘There is a man in the moon.’
‘There are lots of birds on the tree.’

example.label: MaiExist
example.translation: ‘ “There shall be blood in the world”, he said’

example.label: MaiLoc
example.translation: ‘His rifle was there under his coat.’
‘There are no pigs in this village.’

example.label: AjiExist
example.translation: ‘There is a yam that grows good.’

example.label: AjiExHum
example.translation: ‘Long ago there was a woman from Kaunuae.’

example.label: AijLoc
example.translation: ‘You are going to stay over there.’
‘At his back (are) two trees./ There are two trees at his back.’
‘The teaching of the parents does not exist (any more)’
‘His brush is at his bushwards side.’
‘He found the field in a trampled state.’

example.label: EngTop
example.source: Speaking of John, he was involved in a car crash.

example.label: EngFoc
example.source: It was John (not Susan) who was involved in a car crash.

example.translation: ‘That stick he planted in the ground.’
‘He planted that stick in the ground.’

example.label: EngCleft
example.source: It is John who lost his wallet.

example.label: TenEmphExamp1
example.translation: ‘It is Lokuli who is beating Loham.’

example.label: TenEmphExamp2
example.translation: ‘Lokuli is the one who is beating Loham’
‘(A) horse died.’ (answer to the constituent question ‘What died?’)

example.label: TenPreVerb
example.translation: ‘It is Lokuli who is beating Loham.’
‘He is a policemen (i.e. not someone else)’

example.label: KakEmphEx1
example.translation: ‘The mother returns, the mother calls, and the children run down to the mother, some carry blocks of wood, some carry fishing line and many other things, they get them and go up.’

example.label: BorEmphExa
example.translation: ‘But the baboon did not overcome the bees, it was the bees that won.’
‘He is a policemen (i.e. not someone else)’
‘When the K’abeenaK’abeena build a house, they first split the tree trunks for the wall.’
‘Kamal does not believe in familiar spirits.’ original translation: ‘Kamal glaubt nicht an Schutzgeister.’
‘Other people had put down their weapons.’
‘It is the girl who sees him.’
‘It is Lokuli who is beating Loham.’

example.label: BorEmph
example.translation: ‘But the baboon did not overcome the bees, it was the bees that won.’

example.label: HarEmph
example.translation: ‘It is my car that is red.’
‘(A) horse died.’ (answer to the constituent question ‘What died?’)
‘It was Chabo who saw a horse.’
‘It is God who prepares the path of our religion.’ original translation: ‘Den Weg unserer Religion bereitet Gott.’
‘When it comes to me, I can cope with hunger well.’ original translation: ‘Was mich betrifft, ich kann Hunger gut ertragen.’
‘That stick he planted in the ground.’
‘He planted that stick in the ground.’
‘Jeff, he didn’t have any thought whatsoever about/because of the woman.’

example.label: SavEmphAft
example.translation: ‘and he stands facing close to Sesepi, the man.’
‘He is a a policemen (i.e. not someone else)’
‘No it is Gagi who works in Madang.
‘Gagi is at school in Madang, isn’t he?’

example.label: KakEmphEx2
example.translation: ‘The mother returns, the mother calls, and the children run down to the mother, some carry blocks of wood, some carry fishing line and many other things, they get them and go up.’
‘I was working hard while you were drinking.’
‘Man’s ancestor used to go to all mountains.’

example.label: JamEmph
example.translation: ‘He was afraid of that (bull), the orphan boy (was).’
‘My father and mother, never unhappy do I see them, I.’
‘(We) mixed the sheep and the goats.’

example.source: John served the meal, after Jack had brought the wine.
Johni served the meal, after hei had brought the wine.
John is scared [that he might lose his job].
She hopes [(that) he has already left.]
The vase was broken (by the ball).

example.translation: ‘The man who bought the fish saw me.’

example.label: WapCondCl
example.translation: ‘If he had bought the fish, I would have eaten it’
‘I am skinning the buffalo which you shot.’
‘I know that she is cooking meat.’
‘The woman who lives in Parker made my dress.’
‘After I peeled the potatoes, Judy fried them.’
‘The man whose daughter is pretty is there.’

example.label: WapSRel
example.translation: ‘The man who laughed is looking at the deer.’

example.label: WapDatRel
example.translation: ‘I saw the man you gave the basket to.’

example.label: WapDatMain
example.translation: ‘The man gave the fish to the bear.’
‘When the white man comes, don’t talk’
‘If you had fed it, it wouldn’t have died’
‘I saw the dog that chased the cat.’
‘The woman who lives in Parker made my dress.’
‘I live in the house my father built.’
‘When a man is lonely, he can’t sleep.’ lit.: ‘When a man’s heart is empty, he can’t sleep.’
‘When the men came back, my mother cracked acorns.’
‘The man who gave me this died.’
‘What did you do with the milk Maria brought?’
‘I bought this horse for you to ride.’
‘The cat that scratched the girl bit the boy.’
‘I saw the coyote that killed the chicken.’
‘If the girl pulls the cat’s tail, it will scratch (her).’
‘John is sitting in the car that Bill is going to buy.
‘He arrived there at the king’s house.’
‘When I was little, we lived in Somerton.’

example.label: DieDep
example.translation: ‘the bite wasn’t bad at all’ (lit: ‘where the dog bit me, it wasn’t bad at all’)
‘The water is lying all over the ground (over there).
‘That is the tree that he took those papaya from.’
‘He took the papapya from the tree.’
‘I used the coconut which she grated.’

example.label: NiaRelA
example.translation: ‘That is the coconut tree the boy did not climb.’

example.label: NiaMainA
example.translation: ‘The boy hit the dog and ran away.’

example.label: AijPurp
example.translation: ‘He calls for rain so that the ground may be wet.’

example.label: AijReas
example.translation: ‘I am not going to touch it because my hand might smell (and) because the rat might eat my braids.’
‘the man whose daughter went to Honiara’
‘As the rooster crowed, they already scraped (coconuts), the men.’
‘One night as she was still awake sitting there, the giants snored.’
‘Then my father asked and then they said …’

example.label: NiaPass
example.translation: ‘He had already made a lot of knifes’ (lit. ‘The knifes made by him were already a lot’)
‘Why did the child call the woman?’
‘I saw the waterbuck that Loham speared.’
’the animals that he went and speared’
‘I want the person that the cow is looking at.’
‘I want the person that is looking at the cow.’
‘I am skinning the buffalo which you shot.’
‘I know that she is cooking meat.’
‘The boy that hit me the other day.’
‘The boy that I hit the other day.’
‘The boy hit me the other day.’
‘In the forest where there are baboons and elephants.’
‘He found his father was not there.’
‘Is he the one that stole the money?’
‘The people who killed Diido were the Janjamtu.’
‘The man whose daughter is pretty is there.’
‘The calf which the cow gave birth to has no strength.’
‘That woman, I know that she died.’
‘The child which we raised has left us.’ original translation: ‘Das Kind, das wir selbst aufgezogen haben, hat uns verlassen.’
‘When/After/Because a hyena (had) shrieked, I was shocked and stood up.’ original translation: ‘Als/Nachdem/Weil eine Hyäne schrie/ geschriehen hatte, erschrak ich und stand auf.’
‘The woman whom we saw makes baskets.’
‘I have told you not to ask Oratsi.’
‘Dalil was laughed at.’ original translation: ‘Dalil wurde ausgelacht.’
‘Ilfu laughed (at Dalil).’ original translation: ‘Ilfu lachte.’ or ‘Ilfu lachte (Dalil) aus.’
‘The cattle was stolen by thieves.’ original translation: ‘Die Rinder wurden von Dieben gestohlen.’
‘Thieves have stolen the cattle.’ original translation: ‘Diebe haben die Rinder gestohlen.’
‘The goat was given to the judge.’
‘Yesterday I bought a knife at the market.’

example.label: NiaVocEx
example.translation: ‘What is it you want here, Sir?’
‘He calls the friend of the boy.’
‘The friend of the boy calls him.’

example.label: MurGen
example.translation: ‘The kite grabs the meat of the woman’
‘The man is cutting with Marial’s boy’s axe.’

example.label: DatVoc
example.translation: ‘This bull said: “Child, I’m going to swallow you now !” ’
‘As for the man, his house is good.’
‘My husband’s mule has disappeared.’ original translation: ‘Das Maultier meines Ehemanns is verschwunden.’
‘Who took my wife’s silver bracelet?’ original translation: ‘Wer/Was hat das Silberarmband meiner Ehefrau weggenommen?’

example.label: SavGen
example.translation: ‘Is she making her husband’s tea or hers?’

example.label: AijVoc
example.translation: ‘Grandmother, take the fish.’ original translation: ‘Grand-mère, emporte les poissons.’

example.label: NiaVoc
example.translation: ‘What is it you want here, Sir?’

example.label: SavVoc
example.translation: ‘Minister, Secretary, you all who went, you will all be fired.’

example.label: JamGen
example.translation: ‘He was trying to break into Evelyn’s car …’
‘I made the woman eat the man’s meat’

example.label: MaiGen
example.translation: ‘They say that Frog Old Woman was Coyote’s wife’
